Configure IOCP (AIX)

The following is based upon information from IBM Developer Works

  1. Check the filesets are installed or not
    lslpp -l bos.iocp.rte

    The output should look like this 

        Fileset                     Level     State       Description
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    Path: /usr/lib/objrepos
      bos.iocp.rte              5.3.9.0   APPLIED     I/O Completion Ports API

    Path: /etc/objrepos
      bos.iocp.rte              5.3.0.50  COMMITTED   I/O Completion Ports API
  2. Check the status of IOCP device
    lsdev -Cc iocp
    1. If the device is configured, you should see something like this
      iocp0          Available  I/O Completion Ports
    2. If the device is NOT configured, you should see something like this
      iocp0          Defined               I/O Completion Ports
  3. If the IOCP port status is Defined, change the status to Available. Log in to the server and issue the following command:
    sudo chdev -l iocp0 -a autoconfig=available

    Make it available 

    sudo mkdev -l iocp0
  4. Check the device status using lsdev command
    lsdev -Cc iocp

    The resulting output should match the following example: 

    iocp0 Available  I/O Completion Ports
